intro: Pasania longinux, commonly known as the longifolium pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded forest understories.
